inclusion.criterion: scheduled for admission to the institution's EMU, GCRC or similar facility
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: male and female subjects between 18 to 65 years of age
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: body weight of ≥ 40 kg to 111 kg
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: clinical diagnosis of epilepsy and scheduled to be admitted to an Epilepsy Monitoring Unit (EMU)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: average frequency of > 1 seizure every 3 days or > 10 seizures / month
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: female subjects have a negative serum pregnancy test at Screening
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: currently receiving at least one antiepileptic medication
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willing and able to complete informed consent/assent and HIPAA authorization
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ability to comprehend and be informed of the nature of the study, as assessed by the PI or Sub-Investigator
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: availability to volunteer for the entire study duration and willing to adhere to all protocol requirements
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: progressive neurological disorder such as brain tumor, demyelinating disease, or degenerative central nervous system (CNS) disease that is likely to progress in the next 12 months
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: respiratory failure (or is at risk for respiratory failure) or other severe cardiorespiratory disease with New York Heart Association Class III or IV functional status, or requires supplemental oxygen
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of epilepsy and is scheduled to be admitted to an Epilepsy Monitoring Unit (EMU) for evaluation. However, the patient's average seizure frequency is not documented, making it difficult to assess their eligibility.
